org.numenta.nupic.util

Class SparseMatrix<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.numenta.nupic.util.SparseMatrix<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T -
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SparseBinaryMatrix, SparseObjectMatrix

    public abstract class SparseMatrix<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Allows storage of array data in sparse form, meaning that the indexes of the data stored are maintained while empty indexes are not. This allows savings in memory and computational efficiency because iterative algorithms need only query indexes containing valid data.
    Author:
    David Ray

    • Constructor Detail

      • SparseMatrix

        public SparseMatrix(int[] dimensions)

      • SparseMatrix

        public SparseMatrix(int[] dimensions,
            boolean useColumnMajorOrdering)
        Constructs a new SparseMatrix object to be configured with specified dimensions and major ordering.
        Parameters:
        dimensions - the dimensions of this sparse array
        useColumnMajorOrdering - flag indicating whether to use column ordering or row major ordering. if false (the default), then row major ordering will be used. If true, then column major ordering will be used.

      • fill

        protected java.lang.Object[] fill(TypeFactory<T> f,
                      int dimensionIndex,
                      int[] dimensions,
                      int count,
                      java.lang.Object[] arr)
        Uses reflection to create and fill a dynamically created multidimensional array.
        Parameters:
        f - the TypeFactory
        dimensionIndex - the current index into this class's configured dimensions array *NOT* the dimensions used as this method's argument
        dimensions - the array specifying remaining dimensions to create
        count - the current dimensional size
        arr - the array to fill
        Returns:
        a dynamically created multidimensional array

      • computeIndex

        public int computeIndex(int[] coordinates)
        Assumes row-major ordering. For a 3 dimensional array, the indexing expected is [depth, height, width] or [slice, row, column].
        Parameters:
        coordinates -
        Returns:

      • computeIndex

        public int computeIndex(int[] coordinates,
               boolean doCheck)
        Assumes row-major ordering. For a 3 dimensional array, the indexing expected is [depth, height, width] or [slice, row, column].
        Parameters:
        coordinates -
        doCheck - won't validate bounds if false
        Returns:
